name: Eiffel Tower
description: Iconic iron tower with stunning city views from multiple levels

name: Louvre Museum
description: World's largest art museum featuring the Mona Lisa and thousands of masterpieces

name: Notre-Dame Cathedral
description: Gothic masterpiece on Île de la Cité (exterior viewing during restoration)

name: Arc de Triomphe
description: Monumental arch honoring fallen soldiers with rooftop views of Champs-Élysées

name: Sacré-Cœur Basilica
description: White-domed basilica atop Montmartre with panoramic city views

name: Luxembourg Gardens
description: Beautiful 17th-century gardens perfect for strolling and relaxing

name: Musée d'Orsay
description: Impressionist art museum in a stunning former railway station

name: Seine River Cruise
description: Scenic boat tour passing major landmarks along the Seine

name: Le Marais Walking Tour
description: Historic district with medieval architecture and trendy boutiques

name: Palace of Versailles
description: Opulent royal palace with Hall of Mirrors and expansive gardens

name: Montmartre Food Tour
description: Guided culinary walking tour featuring French specialties and wine

name: Traditional French Bistro
description: Classic bistro experience with authentic French cuisine

name: Café de Flore
description: Historic Left Bank café favored by intellectuals and artists

name: Champs-Élysées Shopping
description: Famous avenue lined with luxury boutiques and flagship stores

name: Le Bon Marché
description: Historic Left Bank department store with gourmet food hall

name: Père Lachaise Cemetery
description: Famous cemetery with graves of Oscar Wilde Jim Morrison and Edith Piaf

name: Rodin Museum
description: Intimate museum showcasing sculptures in beautiful gardens

name: Sainte-Chapelle
description: 13th-century Gothic chapel with breathtaking stained glass windows

name: Latin Quarter Stroll
description: Historic student quarter with bookshops cafés and narrow streets

name: Seine Dinner Cruise
description: Evening dinner cruise with city illuminations and gourmet meal

name: Moulin Rouge Show
description: Iconic cabaret performance with elaborate costumes and choreography

name: Opéra Garnier Tour
description: Ornate 19th-century opera house with grand staircase and chandelier

name: Tuileries Garden
description: Historic formal garden between Louvre and Place de la Concorde

name: Picnic at Buttes-Chaumont
description: Local park with lake temple and cliffs popular with Parisians

name: French Cooking Class
description: Hands-on workshop learning to prepare traditional French dishes

name: Panthéon
description: Neoclassical mausoleum housing tombs of French luminaries

name: Musée de l'Orangerie
description: Museum featuring Monet's Water Lilies in oval rooms

name: Centre Pompidou
description: Modern art museum with colorful exterior pipes and rooftop views

name: Marché aux Puces
description: Massive flea market with antiques vintage items and collectibles

name: Jazz Club Evening
description: Intimate jazz club experience in historic Saint-Germain district
